gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components
Class PointList3D

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.PointList3D
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPointList3D, IVirtualArray
Direct Known Subclasses:
SparseArray3D, SparseArray3DList
public abstract class PointList3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPointList3D

PointList3D stores scattered three dimensional points. The size of a Array must be given by the constructor, but the values may be set later. For each point in the array, there is an associated integer index. The range of the index runs from zero to the total number of points the array can hold. If no positions are given at construction, the points are intitalized as Vector3D objects with Float.NaN for the x, y, and z fields.

Constructor Detail

PointList3D

public PointList3D(int size,
                   Vector3D[] points)
Constructor that intializes array for points. The number of points is set to size. The AxisInfo and title settings are intitalized.

Parameters:
size - Number of points list will hold.
points - For arrays that are equal to or larger than 'size', it will only set the first 'size' number of positions. For array smaller than 'size', it will set the first equal number of positions.

PointList3D

public PointList3D(int size)
Constructor that intializes array for points. The number of points is set to size. The AxisInfo and title settings are intitalized. Each point is set to (Float.NaN, Float.NaN, Float.NaN)

Parameters:
size - Number of points list will hold.

set

public void set(int index_start,
                int index_end,
                Vector3D[] points)
Sets 3d points for each index in range, including the start and end indices. The first value in the points array is the starting value to be set at index_start. Points should have at least a point for each index in given range. Any points beyond this size are ignored.

Specified by:
set in interface IPointList3D
Parameters:
index_start - First index of the range.
index_end - Last index of the range.
points - The 3d coordinates.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is outside of valid range of indices: 0...getNumPoints().
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If given points array is smaller than specified range.

getPoint

public Vector3D getPoint(int index)
Get coordinates for a single array element based on index.

Specified by:
getPoint in interface IPointList3D
Parameters:
index - Index of the element.
Returns:
If element is found, a copy of coordinates for that index, (x, y, z). If element is not found, null is returned.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is outside of valid range of indices: 0...getNumPoints().

getAxisInfo

public AxisInfo getAxisInfo(int axiscode)
Returns the attributes of the data array in a AxisInfo wrapper. This method will take in a boolean value to determine for which axis info is being retrieved for.

Specified by:
getAxisInfo in interface IVirtualArray
Parameters:
axiscode - The integer code for this axis.
Returns:
If true, AxisInfo object with X axis info is returned. If false, AxisInfo object with Y axis info is returned.
